result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M McRoberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Standard court costs and DNA surcharge waived by the court.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M McRoberts

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Justin Griffis advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Case called at 9:50 AM
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Joseph M McRoberts. 
Defendant Joseph M McRoberts in court, in custody.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
19 DAYS JAIL
Credit time 19-DAYS JAIL
COURT CONSIDERS TIME SERVED.

COSTS:  $243.00 (Waived by the Court)
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 200.00 (Waived by the Court)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash Bail in the amount of $100.00 to be refunded to the poster.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to have no contact with victim A/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Not to be located at the Waukesha River Walk.

1:12 PM Defendant Joseph M McRoberts appeared by phone, in custody with attorney Daniel Guttierez.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph M McRoberts
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: No Permanent Address, Waukesha, WI
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:17 PM Defendant Joseph M McRoberts not in court.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State Public Defender Intern Patrick Sicula in court.  The Court received notice from the jail that the defendant is currently having some medical issues in the jail.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance for tomorrow.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
